title: Frontend News #40
body:
Frontend News aims to keep you updated with what's happening in the world of web dev! With the latest news and resources from the design & development community.
![The Evolution Of Jamstack Article](/images/uploads/evolution-jamstack-min.jpeg) [The Evolution Of Jamstack](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2021/05/evolution-jamstack/) Web-oriented databases, frameworks like Nuxt and Next.js, and even frameworkless approaches are evolving the Jamstack, but the core principles are more powerful than ever. [Read it ‚û°Ô∏è](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2021/05/evolution-jamstack/)
![WebPageTest API Visual](/images/uploads/webpage-test-api-min.png) [WebPageTest API](https://css-tricks.com/webpagetest-api/) Check out the WebPageTest API, a neat tool for developers to test literally anything and everything! [Read it ‚û°Ô∏è](https://css-tricks.com/webpagetest-api/)
![SiteGround Logo](/images/uploads/siteground-news-ad.jpg) [](https://jscharting.com/)[Looking for low-cost, reliable web hosting?](https://www.siteground.com/index.htm?afcode=72c71e3c78bce5ad69eb37d60c7a5de4) SiteGround are running a discount where you can get a hosting account for up to 62% off. With the basic plan, that‚Äôs only $6.99 a month!
![How to Monitor Core Web Vitals and Take Action with Raygun](/images/uploads/cwv-raygun-min.png) [How to Monitor Core Web Vitals and Take Action with Raygun](https://css-tricks.com/how-to-monitor-core-web-vitals-and-take-action-with-raygun/) Looking for an effective way to monitor your core web vitals? Try Raygun! It's error and performance monitoring software that lets you watch the performance of your site over time. [Read it ‚û°Ô∏è](https://css-tricks.com/how-to-monitor-core-web-vitals-and-take-action-with-raygun/)
![Undoing Mistakes With Git ](/images/uploads/git-undo-min.png) [A Guide To Undoing Mistakes With Git (Part 1)](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2021/05/undoing-mistakes-git-part1/) No matter how experienced you are, mistakes are an inevitable part of software development. But we can learn to repair them! And this is what we‚Äôll be looking at in this two-part series: how to undo mistakes using Git. [Read it ‚û°Ô∏è](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2021/05/undoing-mistakes-git-part1/)
![Car in factory](/images/uploads/car-factory-min.jpeg) [What UX teams can learn from a 1980s car plant in Fremont](https://uxdesign.cc/what-ux-teams-can-learn-from-a-1980s-car-plant-in-fremont-5dd417b801c5) NUMMI, a joint partnership between GM and Toyota, offers lessons in teamwork, leadership, and quality control. [Read it ‚û°Ô∏è](https://uxdesign.cc/what-ux-teams-can-learn-from-a-1980s-car-plant-in-fremont-5dd417b801c5)
![Shopify Pie Chart](/images/uploads/pie-chart-shopify-scripts-min.png) [Improving The Performance Of Shopify Themes (Case Study)](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2021/05/improving-performance-shopify-themes-case-study/) When dealing with themes for large platforms and CMS, legacy issues often become a bottleneck. In this article, Carson Shold discusses how his team improved the performance and organization of their Shopify themes, and improved maintainability along the way. [Read it ‚û°Ô∏è](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2021/05/improving-performance-shopify-themes-case-study/)
![Using Forms in React](/images/uploads/react-forms-guide-min.png) [Using Forms in React](https://daveceddia.com/react-forms/) In this article we‚Äôll see how to build forms using plain React, with no libraries. You‚Äôll learn how forms really work, so you can confidently build them yourself. And if later you choose to add a form library, you‚Äôll know how they work under the hood. [Read it ‚û°Ô∏è](https://daveceddia.com/react-forms/)
![Rich Text Editor Demo](/images/uploads/wysiwyg-editor-build-min.jpeg) [Building A Rich Text Editor (WYSIWYG)](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2021/05/building-wysiwyg-editor-javascript-slatejs/) In this article, we will learn how to build a WYSIWYG/Rich-Text Editor that supports rich text, images, links and some nuanced features from word processing apps. [SlateJS](https://www.slatejs.org/)¬†is used to build the shell of the editor and then add a toolbar and custom configurations.¬† [Read it ‚û°Ô∏è](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2021/05/building-wysiwyg-editor-javascript-slatejs/)
![Neon text demo](/images/uploads/neon-text-open-all-day-min.jpeg) [How to Create Neon Text With CSS](https://css-tricks.com/how-to-create-neon-text-with-css/) In this article, we‚Äôre going to see how to add glowing effects to text. We‚Äôll also take a look at various ways to¬†*animate*¬†the neon signs, all using CSS and keyframes. [Read it ‚û°Ô∏è](https://css-tricks.com/how-to-create-neon-text-with-css/)
![Calendly‚Äôs UX example](/images/uploads/calendly-ux-min.png) [Calendly‚Äôs effortless scheduling experience](https://www.reallygoodux.io/blog/calendlys-scheduling-experience) Calendly‚Äôs recent rebrand is a fine example of UX; mastering the customer journey, from the initial website greeting through to the ongoing product usage. [Read it ‚û°Ô∏è](https://www.reallygoodux.io/blog/calendlys-scheduling-experience)
![Webpack dependencies](/images/uploads/webpack-dependency-graph-opt-min.png) [Getting Started With Webpack](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2021/06/getting-started-webpack/) Modern browsers provide good support for JavaScript modules, but module bundlers such as webpack stay a critical part of the JavaScript toolchain. Let‚Äôs take a deep dive into what webpack is and how to use it in your development workflow. [Read it ‚û°Ô∏è](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2021/06/getting-started-webpack/)
![How To Fix Cumulative Layout Shift (CLS) Issues Article Card](/images/uploads/cumulative-layout-shift-issues-min.jpeg) [How To Fix Cumulative Layout Shift (CLS) Issues](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2021/06/how-to-fix-cumulative-layout-shift-issues/) Google‚Äôs Core Web Vitals initiative has taken the SEO and Web Performance worlds by storm and many sites are busy optimizing their Page Experience to maximize the ranking factor. The Cumulative Layout Shift metric is causing trouble to a lot of sites, so let‚Äôs have a look at ways of addressing any issues for that metric. [Read it ‚û°Ô∏è](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2021/06/how-to-fix-cumulative-layout-shift-issues/)
![Developer Illustration](/images/uploads/frontend-testing-min.png) [Front-End Testing is For Everyone](https://css-tricks.com/front-end-testing-is-for-everyone/) Testing is one of those things that you either get super excited about or kinda close your eyes and walk away. Whichever camp you fall into, this article will show you that front-end testing is for everyone. [Read it ‚û°Ô∏è](https://css-tricks.com/front-end-testing-is-for-everyone/)
![Shoptalk Logo](/images/uploads/shoptalk.png) [Shoptalk Episode 465](https://shoptalkshow.com/465/) Chris & Dave talk about linters, and whether we should deliver single file HTML? Should you focus on a specific tool or be more general? And they revisit the topic of social image previews. [Listen up ‚û°Ô∏è](https://shoptalkshow.com/465/)
